text: Hi <@U504BHZ6K> You have this screenshot from a Swagger?
No, used MacOS keyboard shortcuts for screen capture.

This is a pretty big subject but wondering how people are handling ADA Compliance on HubSpot CMS builds? Something like <https://userway.org/> seems like a godsend but I've also heard from some sources that they don't really achieve full WCAG 2.0 AA compliance...

And to the HubSpotters in the crowd. Is there anything on the roadmap to make HubSpot CMS more ADA compliant? For example the menu system doesn't include aria tags which is one of the warnings you'll get from an accessibility check.

This only addresses part of your question, but for menus, I would check out the `menu()` function, which allows you to bring your own markup: <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/cms/hubl/functions#menu>

The boilerplate has an example <https://github.com/HubSpot/cms-theme-boilerplate/blob/master/src/modules/menu-section.module/module.html>
